fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on launch SSH agent option does nothing
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Deploy Windows 10 18363 OS build.
 2. Perform Windows Updates.
 3. Install application from vendor site.
 4. Click on Bitbucket and create a new account (for new user).
 5. After completion the authentication, it will complete the installation setup.
 6. Launch the application then, will get a pop up of SSH key .
 7. Close the popup box and continue.
 8. Then, perform upgrade to latest OS build.
 9. Launch the application from start menu.
 10. Login in to the application with valid credentials.
 11. Click on Tools menu.
 12. Click on Launch SSH agent option in tools menu.
 13. Observe the issue.
 
h3. Expected Results

while clicking on “Launch SSH agent” option in the application, a dialog box should pop up and ask for SSH key
h3. Actual Results

while clicking on “launch SSH agent” option in the application , it shows nothing.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Launch SSH Agent should display correct state

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sourcetree freezes
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using *3.4.2* I am experiencing the same freezes. Sourcetree just gets stuck until I kill it from the task manager.

For me the trigger for the freeze is putting Sourctree in the background for 5 minutes.

CPU: AMD Ryzen Pro 4750U

RAM: 32 GB

Screen: 4k connected to HDMI port of the laptop

h3. Expected Results

Sourcetree should not freeze
h3. Actual Results

Should not freeze
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Sourcetree freezing on being left in background

fields.description:
If the repository list is large enough to require a scroll bar, it is very likely to freeze the sourcetree application window for a few seconds or indefinitely.

Usually doesn't show up as "Not Responding", just a slightly higher CPU usage and unresponsive window. I then have to terminate the process and start it again, but with a large repository list it is almost guaranteed that my window will freeze within 5 seconds of opening the local repository list.

Placing repos in folders helps to some extent, at this point I am not able to re-arrange the folders without freezing and simply resort to using the system file explorer or searching by the name directly without opening any folders.

I check for updates for it says I am up-to-date. My version: 3.8.8.3848. Since it didn't show up in the list of versions I selected the closest one.


Steps:
- Add repositories until the scrollbar appears in the Local Repository list
- Scroll, select repos, open folders, for a few seconds (usually 5s)
- Window will start freezing
fields.summary: v3.8.8 - Local repository list freezes when scrolling is needed

fields.description:
I just installed *SourceTree* version *3.4.2* and find that I cannot create a pull request.

In the previous version (not remembering which one I had installed) I could solve this with the recommendation indicated in [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Unable-to-Create-Pull-Request-Default-Browser-Empty/qaq-p/1213475].

But this no longer works. To be able to do the pull request I must do a _push_ and generate it directly on the web, this does work. But if I try it from SourceTree, a dialog tells me that "You don't have any remotes wich have extended integration settings configured, blablabla ...".

When trying a _push_, it is very likely that I need to refresh my OAuth token, which for some reason is lost for this operation only.

As much as I update my credentials, do a refresh of the OAuth token, nothing works.

I can do _fetch, pull, tag, commit_ but not a _pull request_. 

I think it is important to mention that my account in bitbucket is through google, that is, I have not created a user. Under this condition, to reproduce the behavior you just have to create a branch from Sourcetree in any repository and then try to create a pull request.

The _*Remote*_ button on the toolbar never changes state, always showing the _exclamation point_ even though my credentials and token are correct and up to date.
fields.summary: Can't create a pull request

fields.description:
Hi!

I have this branch 'bugfixes/bug1' and "Bugfixes/bug2'. I clearly made a typo, one starts with an uppercase B and the other with a lowercase b.

When I use those branches locally sourcetree puts them automatically in the same folder:
 * bugfixes
 ** bug1
 ** bug2

This is no a bad thing in itself, it's actually a good thing. But when I try to push my commits to origin it tries to push them to 'bugfixes/bug2', that does not exist.

 

It's like sourcetree uses the folder name to reconstruct the origin branch's name instead of the actual origin branch's name.

 

The 'Affects Versions' field doesn't have the option but my version is 3.3.8.3848
fields.summary: Different branch folders are merged anyway

fields.description:
Hi. Using SourceTree (ST) v3.1.2 (but problem exists also in the latest version).

ST insists handling a specific repo upon any attempt to clone any other repo.

Imagine this: You ask to clone repo A and get in return repo Z; You ask to clone repo B and again repo Z is cloned (in this case, repo Z is called "su4_pom_emv_shared") .

Actions done:
 * Uninstalled ST
 * Shift-del folder _Atlassian_ under c:\users\<user>
 * Shift-del folder _SourceTree_ under c:\users\<user>
 * Searched all over in the Registry for the problematic repo. Zero results
 * Searched all over in C: drive for suspicious files containing the name of the problematic repo. Zero results
 * Cleared _Temp_ folder of Windows
 * Created fresh set of SSH keys (just in case)

 * Re-installed ST
 ** With and without Mercurial (same result)
 ** With and without keys (PuTTY / SSH) (same result)

Now get this: As long as keep using ST without exiting the application, everything seems to be fine (i.e. capable to clone any repo plus even Branch, Merge, Push and Pull successfully). But once you *EXIT* the application and restart it - BOOM! it masses up (see enclosed images)

I get the error-message _*fatal: refused to merge unrelated histories*_ for** _**_ no reason

As a last resort I logged in Bitbucket and renamed the repo. Ever since everything got stuck.

Moreover: $ git pull works fine; gitk (other git GUI) works fine

Will appreciate to have any assistance to resolve this irritating problem.

Thank you.

Links to 3 images:

[Image 1|https://drive.google.com/open?id=1mQsxgtbvVwfGUVUG8u2hefJL00io3hS2]

[Image 2|https://drive.google.com/open?id=1n4U-XVm30MAaRaCdeTrw8sVjtPMlFuzH]

[Image 3|https://drive.google.com/open?id=1WajxgXxZ7743bxPN4vs-0ObinQnj3UuV]
fields.summary: SourceTree insists handling a specific repo

fields.description:
There was an argument injection vulnerability in SourceTree for Windows introduced through git-lfs. An attacker could create a malicious repository which, after being cloned in SourceTree for Windows and enabled with git-lfs, is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.

*Affected versions:*
 * Version 3.3.9 and earlier

 

*Fix*
 * You can download the latest version of the [standard installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-3.3.9.exe] or the [enterprise installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourcetreeEnterpriseSetup_3.3.9.msi].

 

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/SourceTree+for+Windows+Security+Advisory+24th+March+2021]
fields.summary: RCE via git-lfs in Sourcetree for Windows - CVE-2020-27955

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A user is reporting that interactive rebase is not possible in 3.4.0.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

There are two ways to start an interactive rebase in Sourcetree. The first is to right-click (or context-click) on a commit and choose Rebase children of <sha> interactively… The second is to pull down the Repository menu and select Interactive rebase.
h3. Expected Results

The rebase executes.
h3. Actual Results

The user has reported that there are no interactive rebase GUI capabilities available.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
I have a very simple repo in Bitbucket. It does use LFS. I've logged into sourcetree with my Atlassian account. When I tried the first time, I did enter the wrong password! Now when I try to pull or interact with the remote, I get these errors:

fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.

remote: Invalid username or password
fatal: Authentication failed for '[https://naust[...]|https://naust[...]/]

I've tried removing all account and authentication info in the source tree options. I can add my account back in with OAUTH or basic, but pulling or pushing just fails. Is there a separate (LFS related?) place I can reset my password so that I can enter the right one?

fields.description:
Versions with this issue:  3.2.6, 3.3.9

Even since I installed Sourcetree on this Lenovo laptop, Sourcetree is happily crashing. There are days without crashes, there are days with multiple crashes per minute of interaction with the UI.

General context: 
- on "File Status" page, if the Staged files and Unstaged files have scrolls, or if the list of changes in the right of the page is scrollable, interacting with scrolls and choosing different files freezes the UI
- I cannot resize some windows inside the app: in the History page, when I have a commit selected, I can resize the window that shows the commit message/info/parent/etc (resize it against the view that displays the graph) ONLY IF the "Diff" window besides the commit info doesn't have a scroll. If that window has a scroll, I cannot resize the windows.
!image-2020-12-16-15-10-18-937.png!
Device info:

!image-2020-12-16-15-10-27-336.png!
fields.summary: Sourcetree keeps crashing on Windows

fields.description:
When I right click a branch to "Create a pull request...` I am prompted to add an url to the Remote details/Optional extended integration such as this one

!image-2020-12-14-11-20-56-545.png!

`https://gitlab.mydomain.com/prex-attach/upselling/-/merge_requests#`

note that since custom urls are not supported I use `#` as a workaround, which works like a charm.

 

After I restart SourceTree, the setting is not remembered and I am prompted again.

!image-2020-12-14-11-23-08-745.png!

If I look at the config file via `Edit Config File...` there is no apparent change, when I add the host url. If I knew how to enter it there manually, I would, but I couldn't find the name of the field.

 

Running as administrator doesn't help.

version 3.3.8 and 3.3.9
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't remember Remote project configuration after restart

fields.description:
Scrolling a file diff that just barely needs to be scrolled (less that ~3 lines), using the mouse wheel completely freezes SourceTree and making it use ~20% CPU, and needs to be forcefully closed.

Scrolling works without issues when diff is more than ~3 lines longer than what can fit in pane.
This happens multiple times a day (more than 10) and making the app very painful to use.
 
There have been more issues on this:
 - Closed without action
[SRCTREEWIN-13220|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-13220]

 - Reported for older version and has not gotten any attention
[SRCTREEWIN-13305|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-13305]

Hello,

I frequently open a Bash console via the Terminal menu on the toolbar.

But if I open it this way, it doesn't have the PATH environment setting and so an utility app I placed in a folder included in the PATH can't be found.

If I run the Bash console via the Window's Start menu or other way then the utility app can be launched properly.

How can I open the Bash with a proper PATH set?

fields.description:
# *Steps to reproduce* *:*

 ## Open the app
 ## Go to the "Search" section
 ## Select any result from the "From?" box
 ## Select any resut from the "To?" box
 ## Select any date from the "When?" box
 ## Tap on "Find tickets"
 ## Select any class sleeper
 ## Tap on the magnifying glass that is at the bottom on the left
 ## Scroll down tapping on the lower area that represents the train, which is the 80% of the screen. It is divided by a line.
 ## Once you've reached the bottom, try to scroll up taping on the upper area of the screen, the one that is above the line that divides both areas. 
 ## Scroll up tapping on the lower, the one which represents the train.
*Expected result:* The lower area which represents the train should scroll up
*Actual result:* The lower area are doesn't scroll up. The app scrolls the upper area of the screen, but there is nothing more at the top so basically there appears a new blank section over the previous upper section.
*Environment:* Iphone 11 iOS14.2
*Notes:* In order to ensure that this bug appears, when you are at the bottom (at the step 10) you may need to try scroll up (tapping the screen and swapping down) several times. If you try to scroll up 3 times the bug always works.
This problem is solved without any logic by just trying to scroll up again and again until it works.
fields.summary: When looking closer at the available seats the screen may stop scrolling in the expected way

fields.description:
SYMPTOM

I have a large project with ~100 tags. I installed on a new system and noticed that while "fetch" from remote worked fine, I could not "push" to remote (bitbucket). It would simply sit there doing nothing then after about a minute I would see "FATAL ERROR: Server unexpectedly closed network connection".  It doesn't matter what I am pushing - not even a basic commit will work.

WORKAROUND

If I disable "Push all tags to remotes" it works fine.  

NOTE

This is NOT specific to the repo. I have another workstation with the same setup, and "Push" works fine, even with "Push all tags... enabled"

STEPS:
 # enable "Push all tags..."
 # make a change
 # commit locally
 # push
 # observe does not work and eventually gives error message
 # disable "Push all tags..."
 # observe works
fields.summary: Git - Enabling "Push all tags to remotes" will cause Push to never finish

fields.description:
When I installed Sourcetree, I  chose not to install Mercurial, because I am using the app with Git, I started getting a "Pageant" credentials dialog whenever I start the Sourcetree app, and I think I remember Pageant being connected to Mercurial, though I'm not sure. 

Now, whenever I start Sourcetree, I get a tiny Pageant credentials dialog. It wants me to enter a passphrase for a specific key, which is listed in Hex.

I found a pageant.exe in my Putty folder for some reason, and thought it had been installed by mistake. I deleted the pageant.exe. However, now when I start Sourcetree, I still get the Pageant credentials dialog. When I search online for the Pageant app, all I get is application forms for Miss whatever beauty pageants. 

Do you have any idea what the Pageant app is, and why it would try to start when Sourcetree starts? (I think it might have to do with Mercurial, so I chose that component. But, I am NOT using Mercurial. I use Git.)

Note: I am seeing now that I am on an unreleased version of Sourcetree, which may explain some of this. Do I have to uninstall it and install the latest released version? Sounds like a lot of work, and I don't have time today. :(

fields.description:
*Background:* Since Github is phasing out basic login with password, its important that login with PAT is simple and works for users

 

*Issue:* SourceTree will fail basic login with PAT unless a specific, non-obvious permission is granted (which is not enabled by default in GitHub GUI)

 

*Repro:*
1. create Personal Access Token from Github developer options with default permissions, or repo permissions

2. use PAT as password in SourceTree basic login

3. Fails with message to the affect of "user not found"

 

Fix: User must check `user:email` permission (not checked by default), otherwise SourceTree will fail login. !image-2020-11-15-15-14-23-474.png!

Since its hard to guess this will be needed (and it's disabled by default in Github), it would be great if sourcetree could give a hint on this error i.e. "is \"user:email\" permission set in your PAT?"

(Assuming the permission really is necessary for login / common operations.
If not, even better would be login succeeding without it)

 

NOTE: My SourceTree is version `3.3.6`. The `Affects Version/s` dropdown doesn't accept that, so I selected `3.3.9`
fields.summary: Github basic login with PAT fails with unhelpful error

fields.description:
In some situations new files are not shown in the unstaged files with _pending_ active.

_I'm not sure what these situations are yet._

The git command used by sourcetree is: 

`git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks status --porcelain --ignore-submodules=dirty --untracked-files=all --no-ahead-behind` 

Which includes them prefixed with `A`, however sourcetree refuses to show them in Pending or Untracked, only in *Clean* and All.

 

_This is an annoying bug since you may forget to add files._
fields.summary: New files only shown when unstaged set to Clean or All

fields.description:
On my Remote accounts, I have an account set up for Azure DevOps.

as reference
 * [account1@domain1.com|mailto:account1@domain1.com]
 ** Member of [http://dev.azure.com/organization1|http://dev.azure.com/organisation1]
 ** Member of [http://dev.azure.com/organization2|http://dev.azure.com/organisation2]

I am trying to add another DevOps account now to SourceTree: [account2@domain2.com|mailto:account2@domain2.com] that is also linked to organization 2 on DevOps

as reference
 * [account2@domain2.com|mailto:account2@domain2.com]
 ** Member of [http://dev.azure.com/organization2|http://dev.azure.com/organisation2]

 

The problem seems that username ([account1@domain1.com|mailto:account1@domain1.com]) is sent through, instead of the PAT which then does not authenticate on DevOps Orgnaisation2

To do this I do the following steps:
 # Select Tools Menu
 # Select Options
 # Select Authentication Tab
 ##  a list of my accounts is displayed, including an existing connection to azure dev-ops
 #  Click "Add" to add a new account.
 # Select Azure DevOps as the Hosting service
 # Enter the URL, for a different organization
 ## https://my2nddevopsorginsation.visualstudio.com
 # Click "Refresh Personal Access Token"
 # I enter my PAT as both username and password and click OK
 ## checking password wheels spin
 ## the error comes back as follows:
{color:#0747a6}_an account already exists for 'account1@domain1.com@organization2.visualstudio.com_{color}

so according to the error, [account1@domain1.com|mailto:account1@domain1.com] is passed as the username, instead of trying to use the username that I send through since account1@domain.com, is not in any way related to the account I am trying to setup, it must be a bug that this is sent through as a username, instead of the username that I specify.

 

after clicking ok, the username field is changed to my [account1@domain1.com|mailto:account1@domain1.com] even though that is not the username that I specified.

 

!image-2020-11-10-11-43-27-408.png!

 

!image-2020-11-10-11-44-15-482.png!

 

!image-2020-11-10-11-45-10-086.png!

 

so to be precise:  from the screenshots  [gerriep@evolvemed.co.za|mailto:gerriep@evolvemed.co.za] would by my account1@domain1.com,  which is nothing to do with what I am trying to setup, but somehow sourcetree populates this info in to the username and error message

fields.description:
Windows 10.0.18363 x64 - GIT

SourceTree version 3.3.9

I have this very frequent bug lately (multiple times a day). When I view the files diffs (staging or commit), if I scroll down to the bottom of the file, it will freeze the UI and I have to close the process to restart.

Not all files trigger this freeze, but when one does, it will freeze everytime when I scrolldown (so I can reproduce the bug easily on my end). It seems related to the Diff "context" since, when I reduce it, the freeze doesn't occur on the same files (behavior change).

The freeze is instant, as soon as the Diff panel hits the end-of-file, it freezes.

I didn't have this bug in the previous version (3.3.6)

fields.description:
Hello,

I am creating successfully a subtree to a remote repo and pull/push successfully. It appears under the "Stashed" tab on the left.

However, when I close and reopen the Sourcetree, the subtree that I have defined earlier, disappears.

It does not disappear, if I close the project tab and reopen the project without closing the Sourcetree.

I have seen these two post with the same/similar problem:

Link1

[Link2|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/subtree-pull-hangs-or-pulls-into-the-wrong-folder/qaq-p/368478]

Both links belong to the same person.

I have tried the suggested solution there (clearing cache) but it did not solve my problem.

The person, who who was in charge of developing this part of the Sourcetree, has not posted since 2017. Maybe he left Atlassian, and this issue is still there.

I have already asked this question in the forum, but no replies since April.

I have tried 3.3.9 and the problem is still there. 

It seems to be a very simple save issue. Maybe can be fixed very easily....

fields.description:
I updated the old 3.3.6 version (maybe Windows program) to the new one 3.3.9 (Windows App).
Everything worked fien before but now I'm trying to pull from a branch and I have this error.

!image-2020-10-22-13-45-35-769.png!

Nothing is changed from the previous version and I checked the Repository Settings where I can see the Path is ok (GitHub:<my company>/some_repo.git).
Repository Details shows all the data, so its able to load it.

About GitHub.
I use my personal account and also a company account.
This repo is on a company repo/account where I access with SSH.
The SSH have unfortunately a password and the previous version (3.3.6) when started asked my to provide that password. If I skipped/ignored that step I think I had the same error, but I'm not sure. I wasn't able to pull/push for sure.
The new version, 3.3.9, NEVER asks for the SSH password. I restarted it many times to check.
I created a new record in Tools/Options/Authentication, it requried the OTP code and authorization from GitHub. Done.

!image-2020-10-22-14-20-32-634.png!

That error message is still there and not helping at all, I have the access rights but the tool is not using it.



Regards,

Alessandro Piccione

fields.description:
I have some large binaries (16 MB) that I want to check in. In the settings I indicated I don't want to diff this filetype (*.bin) I also indicated I don't want to do this for files of over 1 MB but still SourceTree is trying to diff this files while selecting it for staging.

 This causes sourcetree fo freeze for a long time before I can continue the operation. This is unnecessary and inconvenient.

I I try to do the same operation using Tourtoise Git there is no problem.

 

It looks like SourceTree is ignoring these settings and tries to always display the diff.
fields.summary: Sourcetree is freesing on large binary files

fields.description:
I discovered variant behavior when getting to a git terminal after changing environment variables in Windows.

Steps to reproduce
 # Launch SourceTree
 # Add a new binary to the PATH environment variable
 # Use SourceTree to launch a Terminal (Git Bash)
 # Try to use the new binary
 # Observe that the binary is not found since the terminal inherits  SourceTree's set of variables
 # Use SourceTree to launch an Exlorer
 # Right-click on the Explorer window and launch a terminal (Git Bash)
 # Try to use the new binary
 # Observe that the new binary WAS located

Expected results:

I expected that no matter which way I launched the terminal (git bash) that the variables would be the same, but they are not.

 

Also note: version 3.3.9 is showing as an unreleased version here in Jira, but I've downloaded and installed it some months ago
fields.summary: Differing behavior - launching terminal
